fields.summary: More fields from JIRA issue in KB article

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-847].
  {panel}

The priority pulldown on service desk shows (by default) the single words for each priority level: Trivial, Minor, Major, Critical, and Blocker.  In the priority settings these are elaborated upon by descriptions, but these descriptions don't show up in the Service Desk portal.  This leaves it to users to decide what each priority means, and of course, everything ends up Major or Critical.  

It would be helpful if the description of the priorities were shared with the user.  

Several possible ways to handle it: 
* a tip pop-up that shows up when hovering over the pulldown option
* use the description INSTEAD of the single words, but store the single word values in the database
* place description in parenthesis after the single word priority
fields.summary: Show Descriptions of Priorities

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-845].
  {panel}

According to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Setting+up+the+email+channel]
* If you use POP, email messages are deleted from your inbox once processed by JIRA Service Desk
* If you use IMAP, email messages are marked as read once processed by JIRA Service Desk.

It's good to have an option which users can choose. For example
# POP
#* Mark messages as read after processed *OR*
#* Delete messages after processed
# IMAP
#* Mark messages as read after processed *OR*
#* Delete messages after processed
fields.summary: Provide more options on how mail handler will treat mail once processed
integration between JIRA Service Desk and JIRA Capture
Hook JIRA Service Desk 2.0 permissions into the permission helper

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-839].
  {panel}

We have our own logo added to Servicedesk. The bar is automatically set to yellow: Great.
But when logging in as a customer and clicking on 'my requests', the default jira servicedesk logo + brandcolor are shown.
This gives a inconsitent feeling and seems a bug?

Will this be fixed in the near future?
fields.summary: Look and feel not consitent
As an admin I want the ability to configure the regex used by the Service Desk mail handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-836].
  {panel}

Customers can create requests via the Service Desk Portal, which then generates as issue. However, when an agent or anyone with ‘Edit issues’ permission creates the issue for the customer and then sets the customer as reporter, the customer is not notified and cannot be added as watcher to the issue.

Whenever is attempted to add the customer as watcher in this situation, this error is shown:
!add_watcher_error.png!

It reads: “The user <user> does not have permission to view this issue. This user will not be added to the watch list.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Have JIRA and new Service Desk pricing 2.0
* Create a Service Desk customer
* Create an issue with a user that can edit the issues and access the project (for example, the admin)
** To reproduce the bug, this issue can be created both click 'Create issue' in JIRA or in Service Desk Portal, but not by the customer him/herself.
* Set the customer as the reporter (either on creation or after creating)
* The user is not notified for the creation of the issue or any progress
* Try to add the customer as a watcher to the issue
* The error will occur

*Workarounds*
* No workarounds available yet.
fields.summary: When creating Service Desk requests for customers, setting them as reporters, customer is not notified and can’t be added as watcher
Allow linking of multiple email accounts with JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-834].
  {panel}

As quoted from [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Setting+up+the+email+channel#Settinguptheemailchannel-Usingmultipleemailaccounts]

{quote}You can only link one email account with JIRA Service Desk. If you use more than one email address to interact with your customers and want to integrate them with JIRA Service Desk, you might be able to achieve this by setting up forwarding rules or aliases.{quote}

However Gmail's auto forward and aliases doesn't work. These mails are ignored and request are not created

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Install Service Desk add-on (I tested with v 2.0.2)
# Create new Service Desk
# Navigate to {{Settings > Email settings}}
# Turn on email request and enter valid credentials (eg. servicedesk@gmail.com)

# In your secondary gmail account (eg. servicedesk-backup@gmail.com), configure auto forwarding to servicedesk@gmail.com
# Send an email to servicedesk-backup@gmail.com

h4. Expected Results
# servicedesk-backup@gmail.com will receive the email and automatically forward it to servicedesk@gmail.com
# servicedesk@gmail.com will receive the email
# Mail handler will process the email and create the request in Service Desk

h4. Actual Results
# servicedesk-backup@gmail.com receives the email and automatically forward it to servicedesk@gmail.com
# servicedesk@gmail.com receives the email 
# Mail handler doesn't create a new request in Service Desk for this email

h4. Notes
# I personally tested this auto forwarding feature
# I was unable to test aliases, but there are cases where a customer configured aliases and the mail handler ignores the email
# If you manually forward the email, it will be processed. Problem is with gmail auto forwarding
fields.summary: Alias email and auto forwarding does not create new request in Service Desk
Allow linking of multiple email accounts with JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-832].
  {panel}

We know that static elements of JIRA and JIRA Service Desk are translated by the user language select (after admin install needed language pack), but why there is no option for customer/user to select language in Customer Portal, without entering JIRA? 
 The problem is both in JSD 1.2.x and 2.0.2. 
 Or do we have to implement it in our plugin [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.intenso.jira.plugins.jsd-extender]

Regards 
 Piotr Mazij 
 InTENSO

[UPDATE 13.March 2017] - the case is no longer desired and may be closed, as we implemented language switcher in our plugin
h1. [Translation for JIRA Service Desk|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.intenso.jira.plugins.translation.jsd-translation/overview]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-827].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Install Service Desk (v 2.0.2)
# Create a Service Desk
# Enter that Service Desk and click {{Settings > Email settings}}
# Turn on email requests and enter valid credentials for an email account (servicedesk@example.com)
# Send email to another party and CC this email to servicedesk@example.com

h4. Expected Results
# Email will be processed by the Service Desk mail handler
# Issue will be created in Service Desk

h4. Actual Results
# Issue is processed but not created in Service Desk
# The following will appear in the atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log (debug mode enabled)
{noformat}The message has been rejected (This email address is not used by this service desk any more.){noformat}

If To field is left empty, mail handler throws a nullpointer exception and stops handling any messages after that
{noformat}
2014-09-30 10:31:48,447 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-4 ERROR anonymous    Mail handler used by JIRA Service Desk. Do not modify or delete. 10,000 [atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner] An error occurred while trying to run service 'Mail handler used by JIRA Service Desk. Do not modify or delete. 10,000'. null
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at scala.collection.mutable.ArrayOps$ofRef$.length$extension(ArrayOps.scala:114)
	at scala.collection.mutable.ArrayOps$ofRef.length(ArrayOps.scala:114)
	at scala.collection.SeqLike$class.size(SeqLike.scala:106)
	at scala.collection.mutable.ArrayOps$ofRef.size(ArrayOps.scala:108)
	at scala.collection.mutable.Builder$class.sizeHint(Builder.scala:69)
	at scala.collection.mutable.ListBuffer.sizeHint(ListBuffer.scala:45)
	at scala.collection.TraversableLike$class.to(TraversableLike.scala:628)
	at scala.collection.mutable.ArrayOps$ofRef.to(ArrayOps.scala:108)
	at scala.collection.TraversableOnce$class.toList(TraversableOnce.scala:257)
	at scala.collection.mutable.ArrayOps$ofRef.toList(ArrayOps.scala:108)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.incomingemail.IncomingEmailService.com$atlassian$servicedesk$internal$feature$incomingemail$IncomingEmailService$$getEmailSettingFromMessage(IncomingEmailService.scala:101)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.incomingemail.IncomingEmailService$$anonfun$createIssueFromEmail$1.apply(IncomingEmailService.scala:61)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.incomingemail.IncomingEmailService$$anonfun$createIssueFromEmail$1.apply(IncomingEmailService.scala:60)
	at scala.util.Either$RightProjection.flatMap(Either.scala:523)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.incomingemail.IncomingEmailService.createIssueFromEmail(IncomingEmailService.scala:60)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.incomingemail.IncomingEmailService.processEmail(IncomingEmailService.scala:48)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.email.SDMailHandler.processMessage(SDMailHandler.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.squalor.email.AbstractMailHandler.handleMessage(AbstractMailHandler.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.squalor.email.SDMessageProcessor.execute(SDMessageProcessor.java:77)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.squalor.email.ServiceDeskMailFetcherService.runImpl(ServiceDeskMailFetcherService.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.file.AbstractMessageHandlingService.run(AbstractMessageHandlingService.java:261)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:66)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.runService(ServiceRunner.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.runServiceId(ServiceRunner.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.runJob(ServiceRunner.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:135)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.quartz1.Quartz1Job.execute(Quartz1Job.java:32)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:223)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
{noformat}

h4. Environment
# I tested this with the following
* JIRA 6.3.5a
* Service Desk 2.0.2
* Mail Server = gmail

h4. Notes
# User is already customer. When sending directly to the email, issue will be created. When CC the email, issue *not* created
# I've tested with regular mail handler (Create a new issue or add a comment in an existing issue). Issue will be created even when email is CC'd
# I'm not sure if this is expected behaviour or not, but because CC'ing the email will create the issue in a regular mail handler, I am creating this as a bug
fields.summary: Email CC'd to Service Desk email or a group doesn't get created as issue
As a Service Desk Customer, I want to export the Service Desk Requests fields (cvs, excel) to be able to follow my interactions with Service Desk Team agents in an offline mode
External users should be able to view and comment other issues.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-824].
  {panel}

It would be nice if it was possible for Service Desk to look at other channels (other than e-mail) to receive support/feedback tickets. Other products like ZenDesk (see screenshot) have this too and it is really useful.
They way it would work could be something like:
+ User posts something to social media
+ Service Desks monitors these social media based on filters (e.g. only create tickets for posts/tweets including "how do I" "#fail"
+ comments on the ticket would be a reply on that channel
fields.summary: Multi-channel tickets
Mail handler for JIRA SD does not support CC watchers

As an administrator, i cant view quite some issues logged. I always have this error "The issue you are trying to view does not exist. If you think this make is wrong, please consult your administrator about getting the necessary permissions"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-819].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian update as of 17th May 2017}
{panel}
Hi all,

We've recently made it possible to add multiple languages for your portal and have resolved this issue for JIRA Service Desk Cloud.

Check out the new "Language Support" section to manage translations for both the customer portal and email notifications. Read more about it [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/05/translate-your-customer-portal]. 

Thanks again for your help in tackling this problem.

Cheers,

JIRA Service Desk Team

 
{panel:title=Atlassian update as of 16th November 2016}
{panel}
Hi all,

Thanks for all your comments. There's certainly a lot of interest behind this feature!

We would love to hear more from you on how your team shall add and maintain multiple languages on the portal. Understanding this will help us make the right thing that fits your needs perfectly.

If you would like to help out, please take 2 minutes to answer these questions - [https://jsd-beta.typeform.com/to/VS5QKT].

Cheers,
 JIRA Service Desk Team

 
----
During my evaluation I discovered that JSD is not able to offer a 
 customer helpdesk in diffrent languages for diffrent customers.

In fact it is not even able to offer a proper helpdesk in an other
 language as English, because of bugs in mailgeneration and a stating page
 (http://<JIRA-BASEURL>/servicedesk/customer/portals) 
 which does not seem to care about language at all.

Regarding the missing possibilty to select a language as customer I have
 to state that I'm not only dissapointed but quite shocked.

There are countries in the world where the customer (and sometimes
 also the law) expect support in the local language. If a company wants to 
 sell its products there AND also international, you always have the need
 a helpdesk in diffrent languages.

I simply cannot understand that JSD does not offer this. 
 As Jira Users can choose the language you already have anything you need to implement this:
 - a framework and a process to deal with translations.
 - a software which is capable of dealing with diffrent languages
 - a user profile implementation which deals with a language setting
fields.summary: Multilingual Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-818].
  {panel}

h4. Experienced Behavior:
* Customer sends email to a JIRA Service Desk that has been configured to receive email. 
* JIRA retrieves this message from the mailbox and processes it with errors. A ticket is not created and no notifications are sent to the customer.

h4. Expected Behavior:
* The customer is notified that the email was received but the issue could not be created
* The Service Desk Manage, JIRA Administrator, or Agent, receives some notification that an email was received but a issue could not be created or updated


h5. Example:
Using the Welcome to Service Desk (DESK) project with default request types
* Email configured to create "Get IT Help" type issue
** This request type has two two required fields, summary and description.
* Customer sends email to service desk
** Customer includes a subject but leaves the body of the message blank

The message is processed by JIRA with errors. No notification is received by the customer, agent, or administrator.

atlassian-jira.log shows:
{noformat}
2014-08-07 08:57:03,516 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-2 ERROR user@domain.com    Mail handler used by JIRA Service Desk. Do not modify or delete. 10,000 [internal.feature.incomingemail.IncomingEmailManager] Message body is empty where Description field is required
{noformat}

h5. Example 2:
JIRA Service Desk customer is marked inactive in JIRA's list of users
* Customer emails reply to existing ticket

The message is processed by JIRA with errors. No notification is received by the customer, agent, or administrator.

atlassian-jira.log shows:
{noformat}
2015-01-24 02:32:16,415 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-3 ERROR dev0123    Mail handler used by JIRA Service Desk. Do not modify or delete. 10,200 [internal.feature.emailchannel.IncomingEmailManager] You do not have permission to create comments
{noformat}
fields.summary: JSD should send reply or notification when mail handler cannot create or update issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-816].
  {panel}

Currently, we are able to Brand the Customer Portal of a Service Desk Project where we could choose our own Logo. Hence, it would be useful if we could brand the Main Portal as well. Some screenshot below;
* The Main Portal
!mainportal.PNG|thumbnail!

* A Service Desk Project's Customer Portal after Branding:
!portal.PNG|thumbnail!

*Notes:*
1. Due to the Main Portal could not be Branded, the *My Request* page would not follow the customized look of a Customer Portal as it holds Requests from another portal as well.
!myrequest.PNG|thumbnail!

2. The Customer Profile theme is also affected, in which it will follow the theme from which it's redirected to. For example:
* from Customer Portal -> click Profile: the Profile theme inherits the Customer Portal's customized theme
* from My Request -> click Profile: the Profile theme inherits the My Request theme, which is the default theme
fields.summary: Ability to "Brand" The Main Portal
JIRA Service Desk - Email Channel - Ability for customers to add comments via email without creating issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-812].
  {panel}

*Steps to replicate*
# Configure JIRA with an LDAP User Directory with Read Only permission.
# Log in as a user from the LDAP directory and try to create a new Service Desk on JSD 2.0.2+.
# The error below will be displayed:
!jsd_error.png!
# In the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file, the error below can be seen:
{noformat}
2014-09-15 16:19:02,151 http-bio-8080-exec-21 ERROR johnsmith 978x1726x2 myhd5s 192.168.10.121 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/create-welcome-project [internal.user.group.ServiceDeskUserGroupManager] Could not add user: johnsmith to group: service-desk-agents
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationNotPermittedException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.ApplicationPermissionException: Group 'service-desk-agents' does not exist in the directory of the user and cannot be added.
{noformat}

*Expected Behaviour*
The error message should convey a clear description of the problem and how to resolve it for the user creating the service desk.

*Workaround*
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SDKB/Unable+to+add+user+to+group+error+while+creating+a+new+Service+Desk
fields.summary: Unable to add user to group error while creating a new Service Desk when there are no writable LDAP directories is not clear enough

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-810].
  {panel}

Currently, each service desk user can only view their own tickets.  However many clients have others in their organization who would want to view, comment, and be notified of updates on their tickets.  Other clients work in teams on certain issues and would therefore need one ticket for the entire team to follow.  

This has been a major drawback of rolling out service desk to many of our clients. 

Suggesting a way to manually group service desk users and allow them access to each other's tickets.  This is similar to JSD-270 and JSD-269. 

The minimum requirement that would achieve 80%+ functionality would be to allow admins to manually create groups of service desk customers that can then only see each other's tickets.
fields.summary: Way to group service desk customers so they can comment/watch on each other's tickets
Flagging VIP Customers as ... VIPS

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-792].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

We've setup a dedicated service desk project, so we can have the issue types, workflows and so forth setup to suit/match the service desk workflow.

If an issue gets pushed across to the developer team, we then have a choice: Do we move the issue (and lose the tracking, SLAs etc in the service desk) or clone it and then move it (which "wastes" an ID and leaves gaps in the issue numbering).


h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nice to have a simple "Send to Developers" or "Copy to Project" workflow which creates a duplicate of the issue in the (specified) developer project, and automatically links the service desk project issue to the developer project issue.

That would mean you can have a single helpdesk project for triaging issues, and the development team the flexibility to play around with the issue without impacting the SD team and metrics.
fields.summary: Copy-to-Development workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-782].
  {panel}

Lot's of people, like us, need issue locking, even before Service Desk was created. And every time, this wasn't important enough.
Now with Service desk, this is ESSENTIAL! 
Even with the Who's looking plugin, time is lost because hard working people try to solve the same issues, as fast as they can. Collision is inevitable.
So please, make this a priority.
The same goes for setting different default Viewable by, groups. Essential when you need to keep comments internal.

jan
fields.summary: need for Issue locking, now more than ever
Jira didn't store cc addresses from mails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-780].
  {panel}

- Login as admin

More detail from the attached screenshot

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-774].

On a Win8 machine on FF (32.0)

- Login into customer portal
- On the profile page, click on 'Change your password'
- Submit the dialog with invalid inputs

Expected result:
Client side validation must be in place, informing users of invalid input.

Actual result:
Dialog closes, and the request fails as server sends a error-response.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-773].
  {panel}

JIRA Service Desk notification triggers for a reporter are

- Issue comment event when the comment is not by reporter
- Issue status change

But, there seem to be a failure, when JIRA issue's assignee is changed by inline editing the Assignee.

Notification email sends the same message that was sent last when triggered by the above event.

This is against JIRA Version  - 6.4-OD-04-006
fields.summary: JSD triggers a notification for the reporter on Issue Assigned event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-764].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a JIRA Service Desk has a linked Confluence space as a knowledge base, users can search for articles within the space using the search bar.

However, in the case that the user either A) doesn't have anything in particular they want to search for or B) simply wants to read the documentation for the product, then this search bar isn't useful.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a link either to display all FAQs or the documentation directly to the linked Confluence space. It could be a button in the portal, or a request that will pop-up a list when clicked.
fields.summary: Provide a link directly to the Confluence Knowledge base article in Customer Portal

  {panel}

It would be nice to have some sort of labeling that goes with the SLA timers on an issue that indicates that this is the time remaining or the time past the SLA timer. 

For example: 

25 of 30 minutes elapsed 
25 to breach
5 minutes since breach

  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

The existing documentation on the JQL used for the Service Desk option is not clear, as in the examples below:

- Tickets Created
- Tickets Resolved
- Time to Resolution - Breached
- Time to Resolution - Succeeded

h3. Expected behaviour

Create/Improve an existing document to clearly show which JQL's are used for each filter.
fields.summary: Improve documentation on pre defined JQL filters from Service Desk

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-735].
  {panel}

Hello!
After installing "Service Desk" I created project with a role "Service Desk Customers". After this i wrote a plugin which is trying to find user's project roles using JIRA API.
The problem is that for users with this role plugin can not find this role. As a result, I need to do some administrative or programmatic workarounds.
Hope you can help me.
Thanks in advance, Andrey.

Jira Service Desk (Cloud) Portal User Comfirmation
Allow custom creation of SLA Stop actions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-727].
  {panel}

Sorry, but support site does not work.

You have some bug in design.
Lets detail your object:
Queues - some object for team work. Like agile board. "One window" for real time monitoring. How monitor 50 PROJECT in one browser tab??
SLA - individual for PROJECT
Reports - individual for PROJECT
Customer portal - individual for PROJECT
People - individual for PROJECT

As we see you must move current "Queues" from PROJECT to individual object.

Real life situaion
We have teams:
- IT
- VOIP
- Developers
and others
And about 50+ customers (PORJECTS)

Every customers have different SLA
But IT team must see many Project Queues to monitor situatiion. By filter i can divide issues to teams by params. 
IT team must see IT TEAM QUEUES for all projects in system.
fields.summary: As agent of some team i want see all projects in one "team queues"
Add auto-refresh functionality on Queues page
Pasting screenshots from clipboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-724].
  {panel}

Steps to Reproduce:

Define an SLA with a goal of 1 minute for all issues in a project. The conditions should be Created Issue until Reporter added Comment

Create 4 issues:
 1. New Feature, and immediately add a comment so the SLA is achieved
 2. Bug, and immediately add a comment  so the SLA is achieved
 3. New Feature with no comment so the SLA is breached
 4. Bug with a comment so the SLA is breached

Wait a minute until issues 3 and 4 breach their SLA.

Now change the SLA to add a condition to the goal: issuetype = "New Feature", save it and note the message from SD that issues will be reindexed.

Expected:

The SLA should now only appear on New Feature issues (1 and 3), not on Bugs (2 and 4)

Actual:

The SLA appears in issues 1, 2 and 3. That is, issues with achieved SLAs such as issue 2 are not updated as expected when the SLA is changed. However issues that breached or failed an SLA are updated (as expected).

This current behavior could also be usefully noted in the Usage section of https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/SLAs
fields.summary: Achieved SLAs are not updated when an SLA is changed, but breached ones are

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-722].
  {panel}

Product managers that write user stories and feature requests in JIRA often use support requests to understand customer needs. It'd be good to compile the service desk requests that relate to specific features/stories.

Ideas:
* Applinks type functionality linking between service desk and JIRA
* A description field for the link with a quick summary of what's the customer need
* Some notification connection to keep customers aware through service desk around the progress of the feature (including links to release notes, etc). This could either be through their existing ticket or perhaps on a dashboard that shows their open feature requests.
fields.summary: As a product manager I'd like to understand use-cases for feature requests that come through support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-721].
  {panel}

When using Service Desk for support, something that comes up regularly is the need to track bug impact. It would be good to summarize the impact of bugs on support ticket volume.

A few ideas:
* A report showing trends (overall, last month, etc) for tickets created by certain bugs
* Applink type functionality to other instances of JIRA for bug tracking, with links to all the service desk requests for bugs so you can view the support tickets from the bug report
* Workflow triggering for Service Desk requests to notify customers when bugs are resolved
fields.summary: As a product manager, I would like to know the number of support tickets caused by bugs in my products

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-717].
  {panel}

In case we try to rename the service desk roles below, JIRA will recreate them with the original name. We'd like to be able to rename those roles in order to fit with our organisational needs.

* Service Desk Customers
* Service Desk Team

Thanks!

Cathy
fields.summary: We'd like to rename the service desk roles
Watcher Notification e-mail Link to JIRA
Add RAG colours like VertygoSLA
JIRA Service Desk doesn't work in my account

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-710].
  {panel}

If the System Language in JIRA is set to German, trying to create a project from Service Desk (ie from the Service Desk dropdown > Create new Service Desk) will fail.

It will fail with one of the two following messages:
{quote}
There was a problem creating Queue configurations for this new Service Desk{quote}

or if you switch the language to English, then back to German. No error will be displayed, your project will be created, but the creation box won't be dismissed properly.

*workaround*
Use JIRA's 'Create Project' dropdown instead of Service Desk, and select the 'Service Desk' template.
or
Switch the language to English.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-704].
  {panel}

Dear Sir/Madam,
in our Jira (version 5.1.8) we have plugin Vertygo SLA (version 6.5.3.0; our licence number is SEN-2456349).

We created issue in https://jira.valiantys.com/browse/VSLA-1219, but it won't be fix by Valiantys. Would you fix it (or even it isn't work incorrect) in Jira Service Desk?

This is description of the problem:
We observed some bug in calculation of due date.
Below is the scenario for getting this incorrect behaviour:
1. We have registered issue (for example 1.08.2014) with Start SLA in the future, for example today: 11.08.2014
2. This issue has Time SLA which should start calculating today 11.08.2014, but work is in progress from 1.08.2014.
3. From 1.08.2014 this clock was frozen for 10 hours (for example in 5-6.08.2014).
4. When Time SLA starts today, it has "-10h" in "Consumed time", which ist't correct, because it should start today and it shouldn't take into account the time when clock was frozen.
When Consumed time is calculate as negative, Due date is also incorrect.

Please let us know whether this problem occurs in Jira Service Desk and if it'll be fix.

Best regards, 
Malgorzata Mroz
fields.summary: Problem with calculating due date - Vertygo SLA
Correct JSD link in Atlassian Support Offerings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-702].
{panel}
{panel:title=Product update 8 March 2021}
Hello all, 

Thank you for your votes and feedback. I want to acknowledge the rapid rise in votes on this issue, and confirm that we understand the value of this request. 

Based on current prioritisation, we will not be able to tackle this issue until the next financial year (July 2021), where it will be a strong candidate for development.

Thanks for your patience, 

Ben.
{panel}
Currently, JIRA Service Desk's *From* field in its email notifications shows the user's Full Name (Display Name):
|!From.png!|

This is hard-coded in JIRA Service Desk on {{ServiceDeskEmailImpl.scala}}. As a JIRA Administrator, I'd like to have this following the *Email from* configuration of JIRA's [*General Configuration*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options].

Currently, this format can cause confusion for users, as it is not clear that replying to the email will send the reply to JIRA - as it shows the user's name, the user may think he's replying to the sender's email directly.
fields.summary: User JIRA's 'Email From' format in Notifications
